item.title: #DoBetterDenver
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network

#DoBetterDenver

Denver Homeless Out Loud

THREE Sweeps Next Week - Pushing the Same People Block to Block...

A THIRD sweep is scheduled for next week. 7th and Lincoln is now scheduled for a sweep on Thu...rsday December 10th. That makes three sweeps next week. The City is clearly trying to get as many sweeps as possible in before our lawsuit hearing the following week.

21st,20th, Market, Blake and Wazee from 22nd to Park Ave is scheduled for Wednesday, December 9th. This encampment made up of people who were swept from 22nd and Wazze a couple weeks ago and from Arkins this week. Now the City plans to sweep them again...to some other block to be swept again...

13th and Elati is also posted for a sweep next Tuesday, December 8th. This camp has roughly 50 people and is about half made up of people who moved there from the downtown library sweep a couple weeks ago.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 13th and Elati on Tuesday, 21st and Market and Blake on Wednesday, and 7th and Lincoln on Thursday as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing‚Ä¶

Contact:

info@denverhomelessoutloud.org

720-940-5291

See More

item.title: This Saturday, 11/21, All Out For #ElijahMcClain! Let's...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network

This Saturday, 11/21, All Out For #ElijahMcClain!

Let's hold Phil Weiser & Governor Jared Polis' feet to the üî•üî•

"On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist police killings, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order which would open an independent investigation into Elijah McClain‚Äôs death, led by state Attorney General Phil Weiser. This was after Aurora District Attorney Dave Young declined to file any charges against the killers, then the city of Auro...ra opened a sham investigation led by a former cop which was terminated because it was plainly not ‚Äúindependent‚Äù. Now it is up to Phil Weiser to decide whether the cops and paramedics responsible for Elijah‚Äôs death will face any criminal charges."

"But just this week, Governor Polis quietly loosened the scope of the investigation, allowing Weiser to investigate for ‚Äúoffenses‚Äù, not just ‚Äúcriminal activity‚Äù related to Elijah‚Äôs death, opening up the possibility for him to come back with watered down charges against the killers, like we saw in Breonna Taylor‚Äôs case. Polis also took out the words that suggest someone caused the death of Elijah McClain."

#blacklivesmatter #Colorado

See More

SAT, NOV 21, 2020

EMERGENCY ACTION: Eyes on Weiser! Justice for Elijah McClain!

item.title: This Saturday, 11/14 "We believe that diversity and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network

This Saturday, 11/14

"We believe that diversity and inclusion only make our community and our voices stronger. Womxn of all backgrounds are encouraged and welcomed to participate; whether you are a woman of color, a woman of the indigenous community, a woman who belongs to the LGBTQIA+ community, a woman who belongs to the disabled community or a woman who is an ally to these communities, this is an event for ALL womxn so, please, come as you are.

This Womxn‚Äôs March will have... a select group of speakers, all of whom are women of color. They will speak on the dangers facing womxn today, what we can do to create positive and healthy change and how you (and all of us) can use our voices as one to make an impact on the world around us.

Now more than ever, women are being targeted, having our rights slowly stripped away and the rights of our own bodies being called into question while we are faced with an endless barrage of double-standards, sexual harassment and assault, the idea that we don‚Äôt deserve equal opportunity and much more while still having to navigate the structure of a world built on the idea that all women are second class citizens.

We ask that you, our community‚Äôs fearless women come forward to help create a future that is not only safe for every womxn but free of persecution, racism, ableism, sexism and discrimination so that the generations of womxn after us will no longer have to live their lives in fear.

We thank you for taking your time to read and hear about our event and hope to see you there, at the Womxn‚Äôs March November 14th at 1pm at the Greek amphitheater in Downtown Denver."

See More

SAT, NOV 14, 2020

Colorado Womxn March

Colorado State Capitol

¬∑ Denver133 people interested
